intro: Lappula brachystyla, commonly known as the short-styled lappula, is a flowering plant native to regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces small, triangular seed pods. The species is notable for its short style in the flower, which is a distinguishing botanical feature.
